drug.name: Calcium glubionate anhydrous
drug.description: Calcium glubionate (or glubionate calcium) is a mineral supplement to prevent or treat low blood calcium levels in people who do not get enough calcium from their diets.
drug.indication: Calcium glubionate is indicated to treat conditions caused by low calcium levels such as bone loss (osteoporosis), weak bones (osteomalacia/rickets), decreased activity of the parathyroid gland (hypoparathyroidism), and a certain muscle disease (latent tetany). It may also be used in certain patients to make sure they are getting enough calcium (e.g., women who are pregnant, nursing, or postmenopausal, people taking certain medications such as phenytoin, phenobarbital, or prednisone).
drug.mechanism-of-action: Essential for nervous, muscular, and skeletal systems. Maintain cell membrane and capillary permeability. Act as an activator in the transmission of nerve impulses and contraction of cardiac, skeletal, and smooth muscle. Essential for bone formation and blood coagulation.
drug.toxicity: Assess patient for nausea, vomiting, anorexia, thirst, severe constipation, paralytic ileus, and bradycardia
drug.absorption: Minimal unless chronic, high doses; absorption predominantly in the duodenum and dependent on calcitriol and vitamin D; mean absorption of calcium intake varies with age (infants 60%, prepubertal children 28%, pubertal children 34%, adults 25%); during pregnancy, calcium absorption doubles; calcium is absorbed in soluble, ionized form; solubility of calcium is increased in an acid environment (IOM 2011); decreased absorption occurs in patients with achlorhydria, renal osteodystrophy, steatorrhea, or uremia
drug.route-of-elimination: Primarily feces (75%; as unabsorbed calcium); urine (22%)

drug-interaction.name: Ceftriaxone
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Calcium glubionate anhydrous is combined with Ceftriaxone.

drug-interaction.name: Deferiprone
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Deferiprone can be decreased when it is combined with Calcium glubionate anhydrous.

drug-interaction.name: Dobutamine
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Dobutamine can be decreased when used in combination with Calcium glubionate anhydrous.

drug-interaction.name: Estramustine
drug-interaction.description: Calcium glubionate anhydrous can cause a decrease in the absorption of Estramustine resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Calcium glubionate anhydrous is combined with Calcium acetate.
